marginalia.anchor_text: Ham. I'll play this bout first, set it by a while.
Laer. Say you so? come on.

substitution.copyText: [Drums, Trumpts, and Short, [Flourish, a Piece goes off.
King. Stay , give me drink, Hamlet this pearl is thine,
substitution.amendedText: King. Stay , give me the cup, Hamlet this pearl is thine,

substitution.copyText: Come, anothe hit, what say you?
Queen. He's fat and scant of breath | Here Hamlet, take my Handkerchief; wipe day brows | The Queen salutes thy fortune Hamlet.
substitution.amendedText: Queen. The Queen salutes thy fortune Hamlet.

substitution.copyText: Qu. I will my Lord, I pray you pardon me.
substitution.amendedText: Qu. Your pardon good my Lord; I have.

substitution.copyText: Ham. I dare not drink yet Madam, by and by. | Qu. Come let me wipe thy face.

substitution.amendedText: King. I do not think it.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Come, for the third Laertes, you do but dally, | I pray you pass with your best violence, | I am sure you make a wanton of me.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Come, for the third Laertes, you but dally; | I pray you, pass with your best violence; | I am sure, you make a wanton of me.

substitution.copyText: Ostr. Look to the Queen there ho. | Hora. They bleed on both sides, how is't my Lord.
Laer. Why as a Woodcock, in my own sprindge Ostrick, | I am justly kill d with mine own treachery.
substitution.amendedText: Laer. Why as a Woodcock; caught in my own sprindge Ostrick, | I am justly kill d with mine own treachery.

substitution.copyText: King. She swoons to see them bleed.
substitution.amendedText: King. She swoons to see 'em bleed.

substitution.copyText: Ham. O villain! ho let the door be lockt, | Treachery, seek it out.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. O villainy! ho let the door be lockt; | Treachery! seek it out --
